content.author: vitalikbuterin
content.content:
We, the Ethereum Cypherpunks, act on principles. We fucking care about privacy. We fucking care about security. We fucking care about censorship resistance. And we will always fucking defend these core principles. I wrote the Ethereum Cypherpunk Manifesto because this shit matters. If you're butthurt, go touch some grass and get a reality check. We, the Ethereum Cypherpunks, stand united in our pursuit of a more private, secure, and censorship-resistant future. Like it or not.
hackmd.io/@pcaversaccio/the-…

summary: Vitalik Buterin, a key figure in the Ethereum community, emphasizes the importance of privacy, security, and censorship resistance in a tweet. He refers to these as core principles upheld by the "Ethereum Cypherpunks." Buterin expresses a strong commitment to defending these ideals and mentions writing the "Ethereum Cypherpunk Manifesto" to highlight their significance. The message is a call to action for those who share these values and a challenge to those who may disagree.
